---
title: 'Prebuilt Components'
description: 'Use our prebuilt components to make it easy for users to connect their SID account'
---

## The Button

The `SIDButton` is the entrypoint for your users to go through SID's authentication flow. 
In its initial state, where a user is not authenticated, this button will display 'Continue with SID'.
When clicked, the user will be directed to their SID account and asked to authorize your application.

<a 
  href="#" 
  target="_self" 
  style={{
    filter: 'drop-shadow(rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25) 0px 4px 4px)', 
    boxShadow: 'none',

    width: '250px',

    textDecoration: 'none',

  }}

Once the user is authenticated, this button changes to a dual button, 
where 'Manage SID' lets the user manage their connected integrations in a new tab and 'Disconnect SID' lets the user disconnect their SID account from your application.

<div style={{
  filter: 'drop-shadow(rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25) 0px 4px 4px)',
  borderRadius: '10px',
  display: 'flex',
  width: '250px',
  height: '40px',
  overflow: 'hidden'
}}>

</div>


In your code, you can use the `ConnectSidButton` component as follows:

```tsx
import { SIDButton } from "@sid-hq/sid";

// this should be initialized based on server-side state:
// - if the user has an associated refresh token, set it to true
// - otherwise, set it to false
const [isConnectedState, setIsConnectedState] = useState(false);

const handleDisconnect = () => {
  // Revoke and delete the refresh token from your database here.
  // ...
  console.log('Disconnected');
  setIsConnectedState(false);
  await db.deleteRefreshToken(session.userId);
}


<SIDButton 
  onDisconnect={handleDisconnect} 
  href={process.env.SID_AUTHORIZATION_URL} 
  fontScale={1} 
  height={40} 
  isConnected={isConnectedState} 
  width={250}
/>
```

You can find more information on the disconnecting users in the section on [revoking tokens](/auth/revoke).

### Props
<ResponseField name="className" type="string">
  The CSS class name to be applied to the button.
</ResponseField>
<ResponseField name="isConnected" type="boolean">
  Determines the state of the button based on user's authentication. 
  If `true`, the button is split into "Manage SID" and "Disconnect SID". 
  If `false`, the button displays "Continue with SID".
</ResponseField>
<ResponseField name="width" type="boolean">
  The width of the button in pixels.
</ResponseField>
<ResponseField name="fontScale" type="number">
  The scaling factor for the font size inside the button.
</ResponseField>
<ResponseField name="height" type="number">
  The height of the button in pixels.
</ResponseField>
<ResponseField name="onDisconnect" type="function">
  An asynchronous callback function that will be invoked when the "Disconnect SID" button is clicked.
  This function should contain logic for disconnecting SID for the user from your application.
  See the section on [revoking tokens](/auth/revoke) for more information.
</ResponseField>
<ResponseField name="href" type="string">
  The URL where the user will be redirected when the "Continue with SID" button is clicked.
  This should be one of the authorization URLs provided to you in your client credentials.
</ResponseField>
